content.description:
BELGIUM, INTERNAL REGIONS

Sources: STATBEL; Encyclopedia Britannica
content.question: Based on the map data, which of the following best explains a factor that has led to ethnic separatism in Belgium?

choices.label: A multilingual society has emerged, with several languages being spoken by the overall population.
The populations of the three regions are not evenly balanced or equally distributed.
Many who speak French as their first language also speak Flemish, but few people who speak Flemish as their first language also speak French.
Many who speak Flemish as their first language also speak French, but few people who speak French as their first language also speak Flemish.
A multinational state has developed into a multicultural society where language and ethnicity are of little importance to personal identity.

content.answer: Many who speak Flemish as their first language also speak French, but few people who speak French as their first language also speak Flemish.
